alert.note: Alert for Bottineau; McHenry (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 17 at 12:58PM CST until February 18 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Dakota. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 AM to 6 PM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 3 PM CST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions will impact the Friday morning commute. Strong winds could cause some damage to roofs, small outbuildings, and signs. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
